Description: Gold pendant in form of 'ba'-bird: representing the personality and characteristics of the deceased. Its back is inlaid with lapis lazuli and turquoise. The body is rounded on the underside and there are two suspension loops.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 63
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1994 / Amulets of Ancient Egypt (p. 68, figs.64 & 72)
